poem:
### Across Borders, Across Time

In the tangled air of morning light,  
nations exchange words like echoing birds—  
a dance of tariffs, vows cast like stones  
across invisible lines drawn by man.  
The judge, a silent watcher, dismisses  
another chapter, leaves us to ponder  
the fragile threads we weave, to hold  
this sprawling quilt of world anew.
